column4: how can i see a list of currently running programs so I can kill one kinda like task manager in windows??
use the task manager of gnome
kde also has its task manager
where? :)
try ctrl+alt+escape or something like this
that is to close an open program this program i want to kill has no window
or you can do it from console if you know your programs name
killall program_name
how can i get a list of whats running?
ps
or    ps aux        for everything from all users
ps aux | grep firefox         will show you only firefox instances for examples
crap i have a VLC window running and its playing music, but i cannot get it to stop
killall vlc dont work ?
run     xkill         then click on the window
VLC: no process killed
tri ps aux | grep vlc
and tell what it says
you are my hero!
:D
found it and killed it thanks :)
now where is the built in task manager to KDE?
google for it
maybe ktop ??
